fallout_theroleplayinggame_gmscreenplusb.human_name: Fallout: The Roleplaying Game - GM Screen + Booklet PDF
fallout_theroleplayinggame_gmscreenplusb.description_text:
Master the Wastelands!

 

This digital Gamemaster’s Screen features evocative Fallout art on the exterior and a host of handy tables on the inside. Tables include: Action Points in Combat, Hit Locations, Weapon Qualities and Range Difficulties, Damage Effects, Injuries and Critical Hits, Minor and Major Actions, Hunger and Thirst States.

 

Also included is a 20-page PDF booklet that brings together the scavenging rules and guidance from the Core Rulebook and the GM's Toolkit in one handy resource that presents comprehensive guidelines on creating scavenging scenes and locations, and ways to generate the loot that players can find there.

 

  • Have handy tables for all manner of rules and statistics for exploring the wasteland.

  • Provide your players with scavenging locations tailored to their quests.

  • Guide them through scavenging scenes, from heavily searched ruins to untouched gems.

  • Populate your scavenging scenes with inhabitants both hostile and friendly.

  • Don’t make it easy! Place obstacles and hazards in their way to the valuable loot inside.

 

This book requires the core rules found in the Fallout: The Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook but could be played using the rules and pregen characters found in the Fallout: The Roleplaying Game Starter Set.

fallout2d20_npcpack2_enclaveremnantspdf.description_text:
Taking Another Shot At Glory

 

When the Enclave fell to the New California Republic (NCR), some of their forces managed to get away while the Navarro military base was being sacked. Since then, life has been hard, living under the NCR’s thumb, constantly worried that their identities will be uncovered and their lives once again uprooted.

 

Though the term “Enclave remnant” can refer to a range of people, there is a particular group of Enclave veterans who now live in the Mojave Wasteland in 2281. These individuals are lying low and keeping their heads down, it would take a concerted effort to find them and their secret bunker filled with their stash of Enclave gear.

 

This digital NPC Theme Pack for Fallout The Roleplaying Game is designed to give gamemasters all the necessary rules, stats, and tools to introduce these Enclave Remnants into their games at any level of play. Use the information within to present these NPCs as potential allies, build a quest about bringing the old gang back together, or perhaps use them as well-rounded enemies defending their secrets and hidden bunker. 

 

The 25-page Enclave Remnants PDF features:

 

  • Stat blocks and backgrounds for 6 named Enclave Remnant NPCs, with stats provided for two different Levels of play, including Heavy Weapons Trooper Orion Moreno, and Vertibird Pilot Daisy Whitman.

  • The group’s background and motivations, plus tips on their combat tactics and suggestions for mustering these troops to help or hinder your PCs.

  • 6 Plot Seeds to introduce the Enclave Remnants into your games.

  • A detailed write-up of the Remnants’ Bunker, with loot and clearance rewards.

  • An overview of piloting a vertibird, including the different roles and actions characters can take. Plus a rundown on the specifics of the vertibird’s profile.

 

© 2024 ZeniMax Media Inc. All Rights Reserved.

fallout_theRPG_orangecolored_sky.human_name: Fallout: The Roleplaying Game - Orange Coloured Sky PDF
fallout_theRPG_orangecolored_sky.description_text:
The Road to Hell is Paved With Good Intentions

In this PDF quest for Fallout: The Roleplaying Game, a group of doctors and other caregivers have established a clinic in “Mt. Sin Central,” an ancient hospital in the middle of a ruined city. They offer treatment for ailments of all sorts and Mt. Sin has recently received an influx of chem-addicts who are resistant to the usual forms of medical intervention. The problem is becoming more widespread and the already overworked hospital staff are running on fumes while their supplies are rapidly dwindling. Moreover, the chems involved seem to originate within the territory of a raider gang, which makes fixing the problem even more difficult. The Board of Caregivers have sent out a distress call via Mt. Sin’s Emergency Broadcast beacon. Will you answer their desperate pleas for help?

The Orange Colored Sky PDF features:

  • A 22-page adventure in three acts for character levels 6-10.
  • A hospital full of medics and patients in need of help.
  • Locations to explore within the hospital itself and in the surrounding area.
  • Can be placed in any urban landscape in your own games.

fallout2d20_npcpack4_mariposamilitarybas.human_name: Fallout 2d20: NPC Pack 4 - Mariposa Military Base (PDF)
fallout2d20_npcpack4_mariposamilitarybas.description_text:
You are Super Mutant. I am Super Mutant. We are all… Super Mutant.

 

Mariposa Military Base has a long and secretive history. It was here that the Forced Evolutionary Virus (FEV) was tested on human subjects before the Great War. Here, the unsuspecting Dr. Grey became the Master, and created the Super Mutant strain that would form the Unity. Later, the Enclave cracked open Mariposa to recover a sample of pure FEV for their own ends. Their excavations came to a violent end, however, as miners forced into servitude mutated and revolted against their captors. Led by Melchior the Magnificent, armed with both stolen weapons and the new-found strength of their mutant forms, they overcame the Enclave forces. Now, the base stands seemingly deserted…

 

This digital NPC Theme Pack for Fallout The Roleplaying Game is designed to give gamemasters all the necessary rules, stats, and tools to introduce the Mariposa Military Base and its denizens into their games. The locations and enemies included are intended to go up against characters of Levels 7-9 but you can, of course, modify them and the content of this PDF to suit your own game.

 

This pack offers a great set-up for an old-fashioned dungeon crawl, with the player characters on a journey of discovery, hunting for old world technology and information. But this themed toolbox of stat blocks, locations, and equipment can be tailored any number of ways to suit the tone and feel of your game.

 

The 32-page Mariposa Military Base PDF features:

 

  • 11 stat blocks including several new Super Mutants, along with mutated creatures, and a Ravenous Deathclaw.

  • Information on the history and personality of the base’s Super Mutants and their leader.

  • Plot Seeds that suggest what might become of the Military Base after the player characters have cleared it.

  • A detailed write-up of the Mariposa Military Base itself, with obstacles, threat, and loot found in several key locations.

  • New equipment, including weapons, mods, explosives, and irradiated food.

 

© 2025 ZeniMax Media Inc. All Rights Reserved.

fallout_wastelandwarfare_terrainexpansio.human_name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare - Terrain Expansion: Ruined Red Rocket - STL
fallout_wastelandwarfare_terrainexpansio.description_text:
Red Rocket stops were an iconic feature of pre-war life in the United States, evolving from simple gas filling stations to offer a wide range of services including fusion and coolant refilling services, following the widespread adoption of these technologies in 2066.

Sadly, this surviving example has fallen on hard times, it’s walls ailing, its roof caved in, worn down and fallen into disrepair by the passage of time and the depravations of life in the wasteland. Who knows what lurks inside its shabby exterior, valuable resources like food, chemicals or stims, or perhaps an ambush from denizens that do not wish to be disturbed? Its story is yours to tell, in this intriguing new 3D printed terrain feature.

Please see images for further details: this 3D print file contains STLs for the following:

Outer Corner Ruined Canopy Ruined Door Frame Ruined Door Wall Ruined Double Junction Ruined Inner Corner Ruined Inner Wall Ruined Rocket Ruined Rocket Girder Ruined Rubble A Ruined Rubble B Ruined Signage Ruined Single Junction Wall Ruined Small Wall Ruined Window

Please note: this is an STL ONLY for 3D printing and not the physical product. Requires a 3D printer and knowledge of 3D printing to use.

Our reference consumer grade 3D printer is the Form 2 SLA (Stereolighotgraphy Apparatus) resin 3D printer by Formlabs.

Our Bounding Box Benchmark is 220mm x 220mm This product requires a maximum build size of Ruined Rocket Girder L208.86mm W63.70mm H65.03mm

The recommended print resolution is 25 microns, though users may find the 50 microns setting may be acceptable for some larger objects. Lower resolutions are not recommended.

The Form 2 printer has a maximum build size of 145 (L) x 145 (W) x 175 (H) mm.

3D printable file and model ©2020 Bethesda Softworks, a ZeniMax Media company. All Rights Reserved.

fallout_wastelandwarfare_terrainexpansio.description_text:
Friend, where will you and your loved ones be when the bombs fall? Secure their future the way you want with a state-of-the-art underground vault from Vault-Tec!

 

You have been chosen as the designer of this critical structure, and with this upgrade pack you’ll have all you need to expand your vault with new options for flooring and tile options which build on the existing Vault Design Starter Pack and Vault Walls Upgrade Pack, Atrium Pack, Office Bundle amd Vault Themed Dressing/Scatter.

 

Will you create spacious avenues and living spaces for the survivors to-be, or will you further the causes of science by limiting access to unnecessary luxuries such as food, water, and oxygen?

 

Build your own Vault-Tec Vault with the STL design files, ready to be the background for epic and immersive games of Fallout: Wasteland Warfare and its RPG Expansion. This Vault Interior Thremed Dressing Scatter Pack includes files for all manner of furniture and accessories including floor tiles, hatches, and even traffic cones giving players huge amounts of versatility and variation to build their own vault.

Fallout_wastelandwarfare_PAH_chems_meds_.human_name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare - Print at Home - Chems, Meds and Food STL
Fallout_wastelandwarfare_PAH_chems_meds_.description_text:
When you’re looting the next abandoned ruin, keep an eye out for cans, chems, and anything even remotely edible. The Wasteland is an unforgiving place, and nobody survives long without knowing what’s good and what’s deadly.

 

You’re going to need to find, steal, or harvest your own food, and most of that will be irradiated - even the stuff you need to stay alive could kill you. So you’ll need to find a good source of meds and chems too, but everyone is looking for those - you’ll be competing with Psychos and Scavvers for Buffout, Mentats, Psycho, and Jet, so make sure you take your rifle to the store.

 

Most pre-war canned food went bad years ago, but there’s some that seem able to survive anything, like tins of Cram processed meat, and BlamCo mac & cheese. The wasteland sometimes provides new food too - stuff like Brain Fungus, Mothman Eggs, and Mutfruit. Of course, most of those are heavy on the rads, so you’d better stock up on RadAway for dessert. 

 

Basically everything could kill you, except the stuff that might not. My advice? Never leave a medkit behind, keep your eyes open and your belly full, and maybe you’ll live long enough to run into the muties and brain-eaters, but then you’re on your own.

 

This 3D print product lets you print multiple pieces of scatter to help create immersive tabletop scenes. They could also be used as objective markers or loot. These items are ubiquitous across the wasteland and could be found anywhere!

 

Files have been pre-hollowed where possible, and all files include supported versions for easier printing.

pdffallout_therpgadventure3_showdowninsk.human_name: Fallout: The Roleplaying Game Adventure - Showdown in Skull Canyon (PDF)
pdffallout_therpgadventure3_showdowninsk.description_text:
The mutants living in Skull Canyon have always flown under the radar–until now. In this adventure for Fallout: The Roleplaying Game, the player characters are drawn into a conflict between the New California Republic Rangers and the seemingly peaceful mutants of Skull Canyon. Unusual activity in the area has raised the Rangers’ suspicions, and the mutants may not be quite what anyone expects. As the PCs navigate the challenges of exploring the canyon, battling mutant rattlesnakes, conducting diplomatic talks, and deciding how they deal with moral questions, they will have to weigh the consequences of their actions and ultimately decide the fate of Skull Canyon’s unusual inhabitants.

 

The Showdown in Skull Canyon PDF features:

 

  • A 28-page adventure in three acts for character levels 1-5. 

  • Explore the mysterious Skull Canyon and interact with its unusual inhabitants.

  • Investigate the growing tensions between the NCR Rangers and the mutants.

  • Choose a side and/or help resolve the dispute.

 

This PDF requires the core rules found in the Fallout: The Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook but could be played using the rules and pregen characters found in the Fallout: The Roleplaying Game Starter Set.

americancivillibertiesunion.description_text:
Donations to support the American Civil Liberties Union Foundation, Inc. (ACLU) are made to  PayPal Giving Fund, subject to its policies.

For nearly 100 years, the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) has been our nation's guardian of liberty, working in courts, legislatures, and communities to defend and preserve the individual rights and liberties that the Constitution and the laws of the United States guarantee everyone in this country. Whether it's achieving full equality for LGBT people, establishing new privacy protections for our digital age of widespread government surveillance, ending mass incarceration, or preserving the right to vote or the right to have an abortion, the ACLU takes up the toughest civil liberties cases and issues to defend all people from government abuse and overreach. With more than 2 million members, activists, and supporters, the ACLU is a nationwide organization that fights tirelessly in all 50 states, Puerto Rico, and Washington, D.C., to safeguard everyone's rights.

falloutfactions_nukaworkquickstart_april.human_name: Fallout: Factions - 'Welcome to Nuka-World' Quickstart - PDF FREE
falloutfactions_nukaworkquickstart_april.description_text:
WELCOME TO NUKA-WORLD!

 

Fallout: Factions is an action-packed, competitive tabletop skirmish game in which players command a Crew of hardened Wasteland warriors. Of course, the game is based on Bethesda's genre-defining video games. 

 

In Fallout: Factions, you and your opponent will fight it out on your tabletop, making tactical decisions and relying on dice rolls to determine the outcome of your attacks. Each time you play, you tell the next chapter of your Crew’s story, charting their journey from wide-eyed nobodies to Wasteland Legends!

 

This FREE 16-page quickstart is designed to provide a gameplay demo and walk you through a round of play. The aim isn’t to teach you all the rules in detail but to show you the basics and give you a feel for the game so you can start reading the complete rulebook armed with a little context!

 

Two Crew rosters and the demo rules are included. In this quickstart, you can play through the demo with a friend or take the reins of both Crews, switching back and forth each turn.

 

You will also need

 

  • A handful of d10s

  • A tape measure or ruler measured in inches

  • Ten miniatures (Some suggestions here!)

  • A few coins or bottle caps to use as tokens

  • Some wargaming terrain (or whatever you have at hand)

fallout_wastelandwarfare_rpgpdfexpansion.description_text:
TABLETOP ROLEPLAYING IN THE WASTELAND!

 

Designed for 1 Gamemaster and up to 6 players, aged 14 and up.

 

The Fallout: Wasteland Warfare roleplaying game builds on the narrative wargame experience of the tabletop miniatures game and will include new rules for character creation and creating adventures in the wasteland.  

 

Delve into abandoned Vaults, ruined cities, strange facilities, and antiquated military bases. Encounter Super Mutants, Raiders, Survivors, Vault Dwellers, the Brotherhood of Steel, the Institute and the Enclave, and many more! Will you roam wide and far, or build up and protect your settlement? For those who want to create your own unique characters or use the faction based Archetype cards to start your own hero and see them grow from adventure to adventure. 

 

Includes:

 

  • Complete rules for tabletop roleplaying in the wasteland, based on the popular Fallout: Wasteland Warfare miniatures game.

  • Full rules for character creation, archetypes and original player ideas alongside existing characters from the Fallout

  • Packed with lots of full colour photographic scenes of the Fallout: Wasteland Warfare range to inspire your adventures!

  • Interact with familiar characters and creatures drawn from the world of

  • Background on the locations, adversaries and factions that players can encounter.

  • 3 free adventures totalling 26 pages in a linked campaign or for use as one-shot missions to support GM's

  • Guidance for players to build their settlement as a base of operations

  • Advice and tools to help GM's create and run exciting new adventures in the Fallout

pdffallout_therpg_adventure2_fullyoperat.human_name: Fallout: The Roleplaying Game - Fully Operational (PDF)
pdffallout_therpg_adventure2_fullyoperat.description_text:
Scavenging Run!

Few tools of pre-War America have developed as much notoriety across the Wasteland as a fully operational suit of Power Armor, a symbol of status, of wealth, and strength. Most wastelanders would give their last cap, sell out a friend, or even kill to get their hands on a set.

In this digital adventure for Fallout The Roleplaying Game, a former Brotherhood of Steel Scribe has identified the location of a previously-undiscovered West-Tek facility. Rumour has it that they may have been developing prototype Power Armor and other tech, but the site  has been lost since the bombs fell. A journey through the Wasteland is likely to be fraught with danger, but this is a prime opportunity for a scavenging run that simply can’t be passed up. You’ll have to head out to investigate, but it had better be worth the risk…

The Fully Operational PDF features:

  • A 23-page adventure in three acts for character levels 16-20.
  • An abandoned West-Tek facility to explore.
  • Several departments to scavenge including: Manufacturing, Weapons Testing, and Research and Design.
  • New tech to discover and decisions to be made about its future.

fallout_wastelandwarfare_terrainexpansio.description_text:
The ruins of Boston still hold treasures for those willing to go looking and able to survive the urban decay left behind after the bombs fell. From refrigerators to trash bins to ice boxes and dumpsters, an intrepid survivor might find weapons, ammo, chems or even (mostly) edible foodstuff hidden within this array of street furniture.

fallout_wastelandwarfare_intothevault_pd.human_name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare - Into the Vault - PDF
fallout_wastelandwarfare_intothevault_pd.description_text:
Project Safehouse, Vault-Tec’s programme of huge underground bunkers, was on paper a scheme to protect and preserve America and its citizens were global nuclear war ever to break out. However, a dark secret lay behind the development. Most Vaults held deeper, sinister purposes with twisted science being performed on the unwilling inhabitants who had made it to the various shelters as the bombs fell October 23, 2077.

 

Now these Vaults lay scattered across the Wasteland, some open to the brave or foolish adventurer who would plumb their depths, others sealed tight awaiting some unknown signal to roll back the doors and reveal the horrors within.

 

Into the Vault is a digital expansion for Fallout: Wasteland Warfare that provides players with new rules to venture into the darkness of the Wasteland’s underground Vaults. Enter a new arena of perils and challenges to fight battles in close confines and narrow passageways.

 

The Into the Vault PDF expansion features new scenarios and printable cards that allow players to generate corridors and intersections of an underground battlefield. It also allows players to generate random encounters with enemies as they explore each section of the Vault.

 

This PDF expansion includes:

 

  • A 22-page digital booklet with all the new rules needed to play the Into the Vault expansion.

  • 38 printable PDF cards representing different sections of the Vault.

  • New rules and scenarios for fighting battles within underground environments.

  • Rules for generating random encounters with enemies.

 

©2022 Bethesda Softworks, a ZeniMax Media company. All Rights Reserved.

 

DRTPG: https://www.drivethrurpg.com/en/product/401334

fallout_wastelandwarfare_printandplay_hi.human_name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare - Print and Play: HIGH RES 2 Player Cards PDF (Free Download)
fallout_wastelandwarfare_printandplay_hi.description_text:
NB This is a high resolution print file of Beta card sets – players may need to alter/resize these cards to a more print-friendly. These cards are offered as free downloads to allow players to get started with the free downloadable version of the rules, and are not specifically designed for multi-printings. Please choose ‘Print actual size’ in printer options to print correctly.

 

In Fallout: Wasteland Warfare players build their own crew from a wide range of factions, allies and iconic characters from the Fallout series, and play in post-apocalyptic games of 3 - 30 high quality 32mm scale miniatures through a huge variety of iconic scenery and settlement buildings, from the Red Rocket to Sanctuary Hills, Nuka-Cola vending machines and wrecked cars. 

 

This PDF contains high resolution printable cards for use with Fallout: Wasteland Warfare. This gives players an interim version of some of the cards that come with the 2 player starter set for Fallout: Wasteland Warfare, and includes:

 

- Unit cards for Survivors and Super Mutants that come with the Fallout: Wasteland Warfare 2 player starter set, letting players get to grips with the wasteland and try out the game

 

- A range of leader cards to customise your heroic characters in combat

 

- Equipment and weapons to load up your force with ready for your first skirmishes with the foe

 

These cards are a Beta version of those available with the 2 player starter set for Fallout: Wasteland Warfare. They are designed for print and play only, and are not for use in tournament, competitive or event play. Card details may change at any time.

 

This is a free download. This PDF is not a complete game, and requires the Core Rulebook PDF (free to download) to play. It is recommended that players also download the ‘Getting Acclimated’ learning to play guide (also free to download). 

 

AI and some other card sets are not included. These require the Scenario book and 2 player starter set to play (available for purchase separately), which includes AI play, Settlement Mode play, Narrative scenarios, linked scenarios and more.

 

DRTPG: https://www.drivethrurpg.com/en/product/237132

fallout_wastelandwarfare_corerulebookpdf.description_text:
In Fallout: Wasteland Warfare players build their own crew from a wide range of factions, allies and iconic characters from the Fallout series, and play in post-apocalyptic games of 3 - 30 high quality 32mm scale miniatures through a huge variety of iconic scenery and settlement buildings, from the Red Rocket to Sanctuary Hills, Nuka-Cola vending machines and wrecked cars. 

 

This PDF of the core rules gives players the mechanics and gameplay information they will need to play a game of Fallout: Wasteland Warfare. Included are:

 

 - Gameplay and rules for use with Fallout: Wasteland Warfare models, including ranged weapons, close combat and interacting with the world of Fallout.

 

 - Painting guide for the first three factions in the game, with paint listings and step by step sections for beginners

 

 - Information about assembling and preparing your models for use.

 

 - Full colour images with top down examples for ease of use.

 

This PDF is complemented with the ‘Getting Acclimated’ learning to play guide (also free to download) and the Scenario Book which includes AI play, Settlement Mode play, Narrative scenarios, linked scenarios and more, (available for purchase separately).

fallout_factionsbattlefornuka-worldstart.human_name: Fallout: Factions "Battle for Nuka-World" Starter Set - Digital Rulebook
fallout_factionsbattlefornuka-worldstart.description_text:
“Hey there New Meat, you ready to start carvin’ out yer own slice of this here Wasteland? Of course you are, look at that bloodthirsty little mug. Well, you’ve come to the right place, here in Nuka-World we’ve got all the carnage a Raider-to-be could ever need. Two gangs are chomping at the bit to take a big bite out of the other, just to prove who’s the biggest threat! I ain’t picking a side, but you better, so get in there, grab a gun, and let's see what happens! One way or the other, it’s gunna be a good show!”

 

Welcome to

Fallout: Factions

, the new

Fallout

Miniatures Skirmish game from Modiphius and acclaimed game designer James Hewitt! In

Fallout: Factions

, you lead your own gang of Raiders through the ruins of Nuka-World, cutting the competition out of your territory and watching your Scavvers, Psychos and more grow and change with every scrap. 

© 2023 Bethesda Softworks LLC. FALLOUT and related logos are trademarks or registered trademarks of ZeniMax Media Inc. or its affiliates in the U.S. and/or other countries. All Rights Reserved.

fallout_wastelandwarfare_libertyprimerul.human_name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare - Liberty Prime Rules Expansion PDF
fallout_wastelandwarfare_libertyprimerul.description_text:
Liberty Prime–a 40-foot tall robot and decimating weapons platform which lay dormant throughout the Great War. 200 years later, the East Coast Brotherhood of Steel rediscovered it and spent almost two decades attempting to restore and reactivate its systems. Liberty Prime was eventually brought online and deployed against the Enclave in what would become known as the Battle of Project Purity. The Brotherhood of Steel later launched the Mk II version to lay siege to the Institute of the Commonwealth. How will you deploy Liberty Prime in your games?

 

This booklet provides rules for using Liberty Prime on the battlefields of Fallout: Wasteland Warfare.

 

  • All the rules for running Liberty Prime as a player- or AI-controlled unit

  • 14 print-and-play cards

  • 3 Scenarios specifically for use with Liberty Prime

fallout_wastelandwarfare_unexpectedsheph.human_name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare - The Unexpected Shepherd Part 2 PDF
fallout_wastelandwarfare_unexpectedsheph.description_text:
PART 2: DANGEROUS TRAILS

 

This is a 40 page Solo adventure PDF for the Fallout: Wasteland Warfare RPG Expansion. You will receive the PDF immediately on purchase.

 

Delve into the Wasteland with the Fallout: Wasteland Warfare RPG’s Solo missions! This is the second part of the adventure, and you must have played the first part to continue your character’s adventure. The decisions you made in part 1 continue to matter through part 2, but the outcome is still up to you.

 

The story picks up right where part 1 ended, as you are drawn to leave the settlement of Century, to provide safe escort across the wasteland. Your choices and actions will decide how successful you are in completing that mission and surviving all that the Wasteland has to throw at you.

 

Using a choose-a-path style adventure system, you get to make choices, make skill tests and decide the outcome. The Unexpected Shepherd also uses special game mechanics to remember some of your actions so they may have consequences later, as well as track time; plus, you can play major encounters using models on the table using Fallout: Wasteland Warfare’s AI system to control the non-player characters.

 

For more details on The Unexpected Shepherd project, check out our Part 1 blog about the exciting features it contains.

 

To play The Unexpected Shepherd you will require access to the Fallout: Wasteland Warfare RPG Expansion.

 

©2022 Bethesda Softworks, a ZeniMax Media company. All Rights Reserved.

fallout2d20_npcpack3_reillysrangers.description_text:
Luck and Hope in the Wasteland

 

Mercenaries with a moral compass are uncommon in the Wasteland, so it was a surprise when Reilly’s Rangers made such a name for themselves. With clovers and sabres worn proudly on their chests and geomapper modules in hand, they make a steady living helping the people of the Wasteland for an appropriate fee. They are an efficient, tight-knit group that pack some serious firepower, so if you’re one of those rare individuals with both caps and moral scruples, look no further than Reilly’s Rangers.

 

This digital NPC Theme Pack for Fallout The Roleplaying Game is designed to give gamemasters all the necessary rules, stats, and tools to introduce Reilly’s Rangers into their games. Use the information within to present these NPCs as potential allies, build a quest around their contracts past or present, or perhaps use them as a stand-in for another well-armed mercenary or military group. 

 

The characters in this NPC Pack are presented at “Day 0” of their respective Fallout game, allowing you to take the Rangers anywhere you want. These NPCs are best suited to fight alongside Level 10 player characters but you can, of course, modify them and the content of this PDF to suit your own game.

 

The 22-page Reilly’s Rangers PDF features:

 

  • Stat blocks and roster for five named Reilly’s Rangers NPCs (Reilly, Butcher, Donovan, Brick, and Theo), plus two stat blocks for probationary Rangers. 

  • Information on the group’s reputation and activities, plus tips on their combat tactics.

  • 6 Plot Seeds to introduce Reilly’s Rangers into your games.

  • A detailed write-up of the Rangers’ Compound, with loot and clearance rewards.

  • New equipment used by the Rangers, including a weapon mod, weapons, and armor.

 

© 2024 ZeniMax Media Inc. All Rights Reserved.

 

DRTPG: 

https://www.drivethrurpg.com/en/product/483555

fallout_wastelandwarfare_printathome_cor.human_name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare - Print At Home - Corvega Atomic V8 Sedan
fallout_wastelandwarfare_printathome_cor.description_text:
The Corvega Atomic V8 Sedan was manufactured by Chryslus Motors before the war. This classic vehicle can be found scattered throughout the suburbs and highways of Boston and across the wider Wasteland.

 

Driven by a small fusion engine, stray shots risk detonating the rusting remains of these vehicles so caution when exploring is advised.

fallout_wastelandwarfare_terrainexpansio.description_text:
Friend, where will you and your loved ones be when the bombs fall? Secure their future the way you want with a state-of-the-art underground vault from Vault-Tec!

 

You have been chosen as the designer of this critical structure, and with the Vault Walls Upgrade Pack you’ll have all you need to expand your vault with new options for walls and scenery which build on the existing Vault Design Starter Pack, Vault Walls Upgrade Pack and Vault Tech Atirum Pack.

 

Will you create spacious avenues and living spaces for the survivors to-be, or will you further the causes of science by limiting access to unnecessary luxuries such as food, water, and oxygen?

 

Build your own Vault-Tec Vault with the STL design files, ready to be the background for epic and immersive games of Fallout: Wasteland Warfare and its RPG Expansion.

 

This Vault Atrium Pack includes files for Heavy Duty Consoles, Modular Shelving, Crates and miscellanous items, giving players huge amounts of versatility and variation to build their own vault.

 

Includes:

 

STL printable files for:

  • Modular Shelving

  • Crates

  • Miscellanous items (see pics for contents)

fallout_theroleplayinggamewanderersguide.human_name: Fallout: The Roleplaying Game Wanderers Guide Book (PDF)
fallout_theroleplayinggamewanderersguide.description_text:
Explore the Unknown!

 

Journeying through the devastated wasteland, resourceful wanderers from all walks of life travel from settlement to settlement in order to survive and, sometimes, even thrive! Now, the Wanderer’s Guide Book for Fallout: The Roleplaying Game gives you new tools to create wanderer characters, equip them with weapons and vehicles, and send them into the wasteland to face deadly new adversaries.

 

The Wanderer’s Guide Book includes a wealth of content for both players and gamemasters. If you want new character origins, perks, and equipment, you’ll find them here. If you want quick and easy scavenging locations, look no further! But watch out for the expansive bestiary full of creatures and factions that make the wasteland so dangerous.

 

Within the 236-page Wanderer’s Guide Book PDF you will:

 

  • Create new characters from brand new origins, including the Brotherhood Outcast, Child of Atom, Nightkin, robots, and more!

  • Scavenge anywhere in the Wasteland with pre-built locations or use them to create your own! Spend your Luck for chances at more loot!

  • Get ahead of the competition with 54 brand new perks. Become fireproof, fight like a gladiator, work those healing hands, or become a natural born survivor. Remind everyone why you’re SPECIAL.

  • Loads of new equipment just waiting to be found in the Wasteland! Create your own legendary weapons and armor!

  • Introducing vehicles and new rules to tear across the Wastes! Roll in style in a Chryslus Cherry Bomb or soar the skies in a Vertibird.

  • Create unforgettable legendary foes and creatures with new optional rules. Evolve your enemies with new legendary abilities that mutate as the fight goes on!

  • Face off against a myriad of new creatures and foes from cryptids, mutated experiments, and iconic factions across the East and West coasts.

 

This book requires the core rules found in the Fallout: The Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook.

 

© 1997-2024 Bethesda Softworks LLC, a ZeniMax Media company. Bethesda Softworks, ZeniMax and related logos are registered trademarks or trademarks of ZeniMax Media Inc. in the U.S. and/or other countries. Fallout and related logos are trademarks or registered trademarks of Bethesda Softworks LLC in the U.S. and/or other countries. All Rights Reserved.

fallout_wastelandwarfare_printathome_bro.human_name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare - Print at Home - Brotherhood of Steel Encampment STL
fallout_wastelandwarfare_printathome_bro.description_text:
Many divisions of the Brotherhood of Steel are entrenched in incredibly secure bunkers, but their mission to preserve pre-war technologies often requires them to leave their headquarters and head out into the Wasteland. Major field operations will require a forward expeditionary camp where Knights and Scribes can work to retrieve discovered tech, while safely defended by heavily armed and armoured Paladins. Such camps are routinely fortified with lookout platforms, mechanised turrets, and barricades of all kinds.  The Brotherhood of Steel is a well-oiled military machine and their camps are no exception. 

 

Heavy-duty tents might be a poor substitute for the security of thick concrete walls, but they will easily serve as temporary barracks and command posts for the duration of the field mission. Infirmaries will also be required in the event of conflict with locals who might be in possession of the very technology the Brotherhood wants to reclaim. Evidence of previous conflicts may lie nearby, along with the corpses of long-dead soldiers who once bore the technology that the Brotherhood has decided to reclaim. 

 

This 3D print product lets you print multiple pieces of scatter to help create immersive tabletop scenes. They could also be used to build defensible positions, dig sites, camping grounds, or to flesh out more densely populated areas. Although designed with the Brotherhood of Steel in mind, these items can easily be used or repurposed by any faction of the Wasteland.

 

Files have been pre-hollowed where possible, and all files include supported versions for easier printing.

americancivillibertiesunion.description_text:
Donations to support the American Civil Liberties Union Foundation, Inc. (ACLU) are made to  PayPal Giving Fund, subject to its policies.

For nearly 100 years, the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) has been our nation's guardian of liberty, working in courts, legislatures, and communities to defend and preserve the individual rights and liberties that the Constitution and the laws of the United States guarantee everyone in this country. Whether it's achieving full equality for LGBT people, establishing new privacy protections for our digital age of widespread government surveillance, ending mass incarceration, or preserving the right to vote or the right to have an abortion, the ACLU takes up the toughest civil liberties cases and issues to defend all people from government abuse and overreach. With more than 2 million members, activists, and supporters, the ACLU is a nationwide organization that fights tirelessly in all 50 states, Puerto Rico, and Washington, D.C., to safeguard everyone's rights.

Next, you’ll build summarization workflows using n8n AI Chains, allowing your automations to condense and process large volumes of information. Finally, you’ll move into AI agent automations, where you’ll connect agents to language models, enable web search, and implement conversation memory so agents can retain context across interactions.

By the end of this video course, you won’t just understand how n8n works with LLMs; you’ll be able to design intelligent, multi-step automations that behave like real agents.

✔️ Lifetime access

✔️ Source files included (JSON workflows to import into n8n)
